content.label: I've been hooked since day one.
Only reason I bought the iPhone 7 is so I could play this game it is well worth it best strategy on Mobil period
Great game. One small bug: sometimes troops are deplayed on a rocky outcropping or group of houses and they cant move at all.

Let me play the entire game and than ask me for a review? That's awesome tired of being asked by other apps for a review every 10 minutes. But the gameplay? Pretty good, I liked the total war feel to it :)

title.label: BY FAR the best strategy game

content.label: Love it, great game!
It took me a while to buy this game, since the initial reviews seemed to be written by the company, broken English and all.  This is a very entertaining game...I've finished it w 5 of the 9 so far.

I have been looking for a conquering style game (total war style) with some good strategy elements for a while and this is a great game I found recently. There are several systems involved - explore, economy, warfare, diplomacy, technology. And also a cool rts style battle as a bonus.

title.label: Outstanding and better than anything else here

content.label:
I have played the long campaign to completion, and I can honestly say that this game is superior to any strategy game I have played from the App Store. I am a fan of strategy games, especially the total war series and this game really delivered.

I do think it lacks some user-friendliness when it comes to managing your empire. You really do have to visit each province and check for free troops and construction progress. It becomes a bit of a grind as your empire expands. 

Overall though, this is probably the best strategy game you can get for iPhone.
I loved playing the first Autumn Dynasty game. And Warlords is so much better. It's well worth it and there is no in game purchases. You pay the up front price and it's fun to play for a long time.
Wish the game had more options on it, like weapons and other things. All in all it is a great game.
The map is big enough to allow for a complex game but small enough to work on a phone or tablet. Well conceived and beautiful. Fun to play multiple times.
Lots of fun. Keep it up!

This game is stellar, very unique on the App Store as it plays like Total War, more than the one Total War game. An enjoyable TBS (turn-based strategy) 4X game (Four ex's: explore, expand, exploit, exterminate) complete with enjoyable RTS (real-time strategy) for the actual battles. Best strategy game on the App Store, hands down.

title.label: Great game! Even better for money.

content.label: Game has great replayability.  Simple to learn  but deeper complexity is there for the strategy veteran. Great buy.  Only minor issue is auto save which needs to happen more often. Infrequently crashes.

We need more strategy war games like this! I love playing this game their is so much to do! 
If you guys could would I be possible to maybe add onto this game like different map set up,more characters and even sea battles with turtle ships! Thanks!

Excellent turn-based strategy! On the iPad! Finally. Enough complexity to keep it interesting, too: unit abilities, officer talents, building improvements, trade, economy, population growth and contentment, factions to please, artifacts to discover... Serious replay value. This is easily the best game I've found for the pad that actually demands STRATEGY.

iCloud support please: saves and setting 
best RTS game on IOS, keep it up!
On iPhone this meets my tactical strategy game fix. Amazing immersive music.
Entertaining

title.label: Just what I was looking for!

content.label: I was searching for a strategy war game that didn't require in-app purchases in order for the game to be fun. Plus, I've always liked AOE2 for pc and I needed to satisfy that itch. This game was great, I got mildly addicted to it until I conquered my first map. The computer challengers are competitive but not so much I couldn't recover, in normal mode at least. I'm going to up the difficulty and try to conquer another map.
Loads of fun and a great time killer with a tremendous amount of depth.
Which is like 3 cents a day right? Love this game. Needs a sequel. Its just not a huge complex game like romance so the fun runs out after you beat it on hard. Probably the best purchase i have made.

title.label: Best strategy game on iOS but needs more units.

content.label:
This game is very addicting but I've been getting of using the same old troops and just doing the same actions. I think we could have units kinda like a samurai unit or barbarians. Here is a list of what type of troops we can have. 
1. Pikemen
2. Heroes
3. Hunters
4. Vikings
5. Generals (officers) that can actually participate in battle.
6. Club men 
Maybe archers that can have a skill to switch back and forth from a bow to a short sword.
I wish the App Store had more games like this. Def. in a league of its own

I really like the broad feel of this game. It's reminiscent of Total War and Civilization. However, the battles take a long time and cannot be simulated. The game could also use a guide where you can see the effects of all the different units and buildings. As far as I can tell, this does not exist in one consolidated place. It's a fantastic concept, and it's very in-depth for an app, but the battles take so long that I've given up on the game before finishing my first play through.
Great game
Great game, one of the best I've seen!

Hands down one of the greatest iOS games I've ever played. If you enjoy strategy games you can't do better than this. Incredibly rich and detailed production with beautiful artwork and a fantastic score.

title.label: A koei throwback with an rts upgrade

content.label: a koei throw back similar to nobunagas ambition. I had been looking for something like this since iOS started releasing games. Loved the rts component and the societies. Polishing points would include having additional warlords and the ability to assassinate and marry.  Overall maybe not the most in depth strategy game but definitely the best overall strategy game I've played on iOS. Great work.
By far one of the best games in general I've played on IOS. I just finished one full game and I am about to start another  with a different leader and a higher difficulty!

As a huge fan of Rome total war I love this game but it would be nice if it was a little harder to beat. Not just by increasing the difficulty in battles. Once you get the hang of it you just dominate.
I bought this thinking it has multiplayer like the first one...

Definitely worth the money. I was looking for a quality turn-based strategy game and found it in this one. It's nice they included the real-time battles although they are pretty basic tactically speaking. But overall a great game, especially if you enjoy Total War style games.
My 10 year-old daughter and I enjoy playing it. Aesthetically it is beautiful. We can play it for hours on end.
Ever play civilization revolution? If so you'll love this game
Just that

Good game overall, and for a decent price. Generally similar to the total war style of empire manage tbs and rts battles. Gameplay is a little shallow and derivative and there is a world but not much real storyline. Still good fun, though!

Like that and many other empire building strategy games once you have conquered a majority of the territories you have basically won and the remainder of the game becomes tedious mop up.

Game is unplayable. Tutorial is almost useless, you basically have to stumble through using every one of the countless actions then hope you can figure out what the result was. I conquered a 2nd province, the two combined incomes are over 4000 but my gold only goes up 300 each turn and there's no way to figure out the discrepancy. Cant get gold to do anything so the game is useless now. Save your money and look elsewhere.
Fan of Romance of the Three Kingdom KOEI game would love this game!
This game is great the ability to control your army and change your strategy during skirmish.
A true masterpiece comparable to Shogun 2 only thing that it needs is a slightly more aggressive AI

title.label: Fun game mechanics need a bit of work

content.label: I enjoyed playing this game. The strategy elements are like Risk on steroids. Three complaints. The counter attack when you have 30 exhausted troops in a zone makes no sense at all. Grouping units by circling is nit as good as in autumn making movements clunky. Building benefits should be explained better. It is hard to see a universal genetic vs a regional.
Crashed too often

Great game! Just finished my first game and planning on starting another, definitely worth the 7$ 
There are a few glitches like troops spawning in mountains and being unable to move but on whole a well made game and i cant wait for what they might make after this!

title.label: Great game total war on a smaller scale

content.label:
Great really fun 
Addicting 
Like total war
Good strategy game
Won't be able to put it down
This game manage to perfectly design everything
One of the best games I've played on the iPhone. A must get.  I almost hoped the battles were harder and more places to build buildings per province.  Also can't find any azure scrolls missions

title.label: Good, hard to see on iphone 5, crashes sometimes

content.label: Good, hard to see on iphone 5, crashes sometimes

title.label: So much worse than other autumn

content.label: Very clunky and uncool compared to the other autumn game. Hate this.

Wooowwww.... So so so impressed!!! It is a beautiful game!!!! But it really needs a new update... It would be awesome if you made the map way bigger, and added other land masses. Like other country's. And have the coastline provinces have harbors where you can build ships. This is the best rts game out there. And the best game in the whole App Store.
